meanings.sent1: She dashed across the finish line with a big smile.
meanings.sent2: The cat dashed out of the room when the door opened.
meanings.sent3: I dashed to the store only to realize it was closed.
meanings.sent4: His hopes of winning the race were dashed by a sudden cramp.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm dashed through the town, leaving puddles everywhere.

meanings.sent1: The dashed car was beyond repair.
meanings.sent2: The vase lay on the floor in dashed pieces.
meanings.sent3: She felt a bit dashed when her cake didn't turn out as expected.
meanings.sent4: The dashed dreams of the old house haunted him.
meanings.sent5: The dashed painting was barely recognizable after the fire.

meanings.definition: Used to express mild annoyance or surprise
meanings.sent1: Dashed! I forgot my keys again.
meanings.sent2: Oh, dashed! I spilled my drink on the carpet.
meanings.sent3: Dashed if I can remember where I put my phone.
meanings.sent4: Well, dashed if that isn't the biggest cake I've ever seen!
meanings.sent5: Dashed, I can't believe it's already time to leave.
